text: Hi, I'm Elmo!
One day my friends BigBird and CookieMonster came over to play at my house.
We found lots of fun toys to play with.
CookieMonster played with a ball.
I played with a bear.
Then we each found a truck so we could make them race.
After we played for a while, it was time to put the toys away.
BigBird put his truck back in the toy box.
I put my truck in the toy box too.
Hi, I'm Minnie! This is a story about a picnic.
My friends Donald and Mickey were coming with me to the park.
We needed to decide who should carry our picnic stuff.
I said, "Mickey can carry the blanket."
I said that Mickey could carry the blanket.
Donald said, "I can carry the food."
Donald said that I could carry the food.
When we got to the park, we sat down on our blanket and took out the sandwiches.
Suddenly, a dog came up to sniff our food! He looked so hungry. We decided that someone should feed him their sandwich.
Donald said, "Mickey can give his sandwich to the dog."
Donald said that Mickey could give his sandwich to the dog.
The dog still looked hungry.
So I gave my sandwich to the dog too.
Then the dog ran away. I guess two sandwiches was enough for him to eat!
Hi, I'm Anna! I'm going to tell you about the time I went to pick some flowers.
My friends Elsa and Kristoff were with me.
We talked about who would carry the stuff we needed.
I brought the scissors.
Elsa said, "Kristoff can hold the vase."
Elsa said that Kristoff could hold the vase.
We went to a sunny meadow, and each of us picked some beautiful flowers.
Our vase wasn't big enough, so we had to decide who would get to save their flowers in the vase.
I said, "Elsa can put her flowers in the vase."
I said that Elsa could put her flowers in the vase.
There was still some room left over.
Kristoff said, "I can put my flowers in the vase too."
Kristoff said that I could put my flowers in the vase too.
We ran home to show everyone our vase full of beautiful flowers.
Yo ho, I'm Jake! I'm going to tell you about the day I made some cookies.
My friends Izzy and Cubby came over to help.
We had to decide how we would decorate the cookies.
I said that Cubby could add the sprinkles.
I said, "Cubby can add the sprinkles."
Izzy said that I could spread the icing.
Izzy said, "I can spread the icing."
When we were done, we each had a cookie. They all looked delicious!
We talked about who should put their cookie in the jar to save for later.
I put my cookie in the jar.
There was still room for more cookies in the jar.
Izzy said, "Cubby can put his cookie in the jar too."
Izzy said that Cubby could put his cookie in the jar too.
Then we shared the last cookie. I couldn't wait to eat the rest later!
Hi, I'm Dora! This story is about one time when I went to the park.
My friends Boots and Swiper came with me.
We brought some toys to ride. We talked about who would get to ride first.
I said that Swiper could ride the bike.
I said, "Swiper can ride the bike."
Boots said that I could ride the scooter.
Boots said, "I can ride the scooter."
After we rode around for a while, we decided to help clean up the park. We each found some trash to throw away.
We made a fun game of tossing the trash into the trash can, like basketball. We decided to take turns.
Swiper said that Boots could throw his trash first.
Swiper said, "Boots can throw his trash first."
It was a perfect shot: the trash went right into the can!
I threw my trash next.
That was a good shot too! After we were done playing, I put the rest of the trash in a bag to throw away when we got home.
Hi, I'm Mickey! I'm going to tell you about drawing pictures at school.
My friends Minnie and Donald were there.
We talked about who would find the art supplies we needed.
I found some paper.
Minnie said, "Donald has the crayons."
Minnie said that Donald had the crayons.
We each drew a really nice picture.
We talked about pinning some of the pictures on the bulletin board.
I said, "Donald can put his picture on the bulletin board."
I said that Donald could put his picture on the bulletin board.
There was room for one more picture.
Minnie said, "I can put my picture on the bulletin board too."
Minnie said that I could put my picture on the bulletin board too.
We took the other picture home to show our parents.
Hi, I'm Kristoff! I'm going to tell you a story about the day I went to the lake.
My friends Elsa and Anna came with me.
Before we started our trip, we had to decide who would carry the supplies.
I said, "Anna can carry the boat."
I said that Anna could carry the boat.
Elsa said, "I can hold the camera."
Elsa said that I could hold the camera.
When we got to the lake, we each got a float to stay safe in the water.
Suddenly we noticed that there was a tiger drowning in the lake! We had to decide what we could do to help.
I threw my float to the tiger.
It looked like the tiger was still struggling, and needed more help.
Anna said, "Elsa can throw her float to the tiger too!"
Anna said that Elsa could throw her float to the tiger too.
The tiger swam to shore with the help of the floats. I was so happy that he was safe!
Hi, I'm Izzy! This story is about the day I went to a farm.
My friends Cubby and Jake came with me.
We had to decide who would bring the food for the animals.
Cubby said that Jake could carry the corn.
Cubby said, "Jake can carry the corn."
I carried the hay.
We went to see the sheep first. We each took some corn to feed him.
We decided to take turns feeding the sheep.
I said that Jake could give his corn to the sheep first.
I said, "Jake can give his corn to the sheep first."
The sheep still looked really hungry!
Cubby said that I could give corn to the sheep next.
Cubby said, "I can give corn to the sheep next!"
After that we went to find the next animal. We fed every animal on the farm that day!
Hi, I'm Swiper! This story is about playing with legos.
My friends Dora and Boots came over to my house to play.
We needed a lot of legos, so we looked everywhere for them.
Dora said that Boots could look in the toy box.
Dora said, "Boots can look in the toy box."
I looked in the toy bucket.
We finally found enough Legos, and we each took some.
We built a really cool house. We talked about who should build the roof.
I said that Dora could put some legos on top.
I said, "Dora can put some legos on top."
But Dora didn't have enough legos to finish the roof.
Boots said that I could put some legos on too.
Boots said, "I can put some legos on too."
The house was all finished, and we had a great time playing with it!
